name: unsubdued
content:
Add to word list
Add to word list
not having been made weaker or brought under control : His pride remained unsubdued. Nature here is still unsubdued and existing in all her beauty and magnificence.
(of people, a country, an area, etc.) not having been brought under control by fighting or force: At the present time the guerrilla fighters remain unsubdued. The area is a place of unsubdued clans and tribes, bandits, and private armies. Related words
subdue
subdued
More examplesFewer examplesRocks, mountains, and unsubdued forests surround the poet with power and mystery.It would be dangerous to leave unsubdued pockets of resistance behind.
